column1: Sompeta is a census town in Srikakulam district of the Indian state of Andhra Pradesh. It is the mandal headquarters of Sompeta mandal in Tekkali revenue division.
Sompeta is located at 18.93°N 84.6°E﻿ / 18.93; 84.6. It has an average elevation of 8 metres (26 feet).
Sompeta is a Census Town city in district of Srikakulam
column2: Andhra Pradesh. The Sompeta Census Town has population of 18
column5: 810 are females as per report released by Census India 2011.

column1: Population of Children with age of 0-6 is 1822 which is 9.70% of total population of Sompeta (CT). In Sompeta Census Town
column2: Female Sex Ratio is of 1094 against state average of 993. Moreover Child Sex Ratio in Sompeta is around 947 compared to Andhra Pradesh state average of 939. Literacy rate of Sompeta city is 76.23% higher than state average of 67.02%. In Sompeta
column3: Male literacy is around 84.55% while female literacy rate is 68.75%.

column1: Sompeta Census Town has total administration over 4
column2: 605 houses to which it supplies basic amenities like water and sewerage. It is also authorized to build roads within Census Town limits and impose taxes on properties coming under its jurisdiction.

column1: Sompeta was an Assembly Constituency in Andhra Pradesh. However
column2: Sompeta Assembly Constituency ceases to exist as an assembly constituency as per the delimitation process recently carried out. Part of the constituency includes Sompeta mandal will be part of Ichchapuram Assembly Constituency. The other part makes into the newly formed Palasa Assembly Constituency.

column1: Smt. Chitrada Nagaratnam is Sarpanch of the Town. Chitrada Srinivasa Rao is present MPP of Sompeta .
The primary and secondary school education is imparted by government
column3: under the School Education Department of the state. The medium of instruction followed by different schools are English
